DOC.brief_summary: This research project aim address low-income family ' basic social need ( housing , food , employment , education , childcare , utility ) within context pediatric primary care . This project build upon PI 's prior study Hopkins demonstrate positive impact similar intervention pediatric resident ' screen referral community agency . This study specifically test whether strengthen intervention -- Basic Needs Surveillance ( BNS ) protocol -- lead great maternal enrollment community resource receipt eligible benefit . In addition , measure intervention 's impact maternal well-being , compliance well-child care ( WCC ) visit . The project take place eight community health center Greater Boston Area . The center randomize either intervention control site . Mothers bring infant WCC visit birth 6 month eligible . They follow child one year age . Study subject complete two self-administered survey ( baseline , follow-up ) , one brief telephone interview ( infant 9 month old ) . Pediatric provider also subject ; fill demographic questionnaire time enrollment . The BNS intervention consist 4 component : 1 ) WE CARE survey mother fill wait room prior child 's WCC visit ; 2 ) Family Resource book contain 1-page information sheet resource , provider access exam room ; 3 ) Community Resource Coordinator assist family link available resource , update provider ; 4 ) Training Session provide 1 hr overview intervention provider . Families attend control health center receive standard care . Enrolled mother offer intervention end 12-month follow-up interview . When follow-up data collection complete , PI offer control sit opportunity implement BNS protocol .
